intro: Ervum kurdistanum, commonly known as the Kurdish vetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod-bearing fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring trifoliate leaves and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its seeds are enclosed in slender, cylindrical pods and are often used in traditional medicine. Ervum kurdistanum is also valued as a forage plant for livestock in its native habitats.
